column4: hey, can someone help me get japanese input working on my machine?
what do you wish to use, SCIM or UIM?
are the both included with ubuntu by default? i've been trying to use SCIM but whichever one you would recommend
Let me check if my uim works on openoffice ...
okay, thanks

okay uim works on openoffice too. So I'm suggesting uim. there are situations where it doesn't work though. for example, in opera, you can't use it in ctrl-f, but you can use it everywhere else. and it also works on terminal, on firefox, etc etc
let's go with uim
what is the difference between the two?
they work differently but users usually don't notice it. it's mostly how they interface with the apps. otherwise, they use the same engines (anthy, skk, canna, etc)
and I always have scim work on one toolkit (i.e. gtk) and fail on another (i.e. qt)
okay, so SCIM has started to work somehow and it was only needed for IM so i actually think i'm set
so you have scim-anthy installed too?
did you install via language support?
i installed via language support, yeah
okay, go to console and do this: im-switch -c
and then select.... wait I forgot after that
wait, why? SCIM is working
really? so it needs no config?
idk, guess not
strange. last time it only worked when you logged in with japanese language. it didn't start automatically in english
prob they fixed that huh
well i'm using jaunty, maybe they made some improvements?
anyways, thanks for the help!
